intro: Scabiosa columbaria var. triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its nectar-rich flowers attract bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological value.
